page.title: 14LOCAL HISTORY: QUINTON
page.content: Once the{centre of village craft}and life, Friday Street lies right next to the{church of St.Swithin, Quinton. The street takes its name from St. Frideswide, English abbess and patron saint of Oxford.{Magdalen College, Oxford, owns many properties in the village, and built a clubroom for villagers in Friday Street in 1890.This is now a hairdresser's as is the old village general stores and post office, also in this street. Friday Street contains 4 examples of timber frame thatched cottages with wattle and daub infill. One of these has the macabre history of being the home of the last suspected victim of a witchcraft murder ( Meon Hill, 1945) No.25 built with roof beams of green timber,cut locally,was once threatened and is now a class 2 listed building.
